safire.utils.matutils module¶

math.py is a library that provides mathematical utility functions.

safire.utils.matutils.avg(iterable, weights=None)[source]¶

Returns the average from the iterable (assumes that the iterable can be summed). If weights are given, the weighed average is computed.

Weights do not have to be normalized.

safire.utils.matutils.avg_grid(grid, use_cols=None, cols=True)[source]¶

Computes average MSE between given matrix columns.

safire.utils.matutils.avg_pairwise_mutual_precision(items)[source]¶

Computes the average pairwise mutual precision of all the given items.

safire.utils.matutils.crmse(x, y)[source]¶

Mean-normalized RMSE.

safire.utils.matutils.f_score(prediction, true, w_prec=0.5, w_rec=0.5)[source]¶

Computes the weighed f-score of the prediction item predicting members of the test item.

Currently only supports f1-score.

safire.utils.matutils.generate_grid(matrix, fn, use_cols=None, cols=True)[source]¶

Returns mean squared errors between pairs of matrix columns. Results are returned as a grid dict with keys in use_cols.

safire.utils.matutils.grid2sym_matrix(grid)[source]¶

Unrolls the grid into a 2d ndarray. Assumes that the grid is an upper diagonal. Doesn’t symmetrize (the rest is left at 0.0).

safire.utils.matutils.grid_max(grid)[source]¶
safire.utils.matutils.kappa(a1, a2, length=12.0)[source]¶

Computes Cohen’s kappa for the given annotation members. The length parameter is used to see how many

safire.utils.matutils.mae(x, y)[source]¶

Mean absolute error.

safire.utils.matutils.maxn_sparse_rmse(x, y)[source]¶

Computes proportion of attainable RMSE. Assumes X and Y are sparse enough so that if X is sorted min->max and Y is sorted max->min, one of X[i], Y[i] will always be 0. For x,y >= 0, this definitely does maximize RMSE.

safire.utils.matutils.mse(x, y)[source]¶
safire.utils.matutils.pairwise_mutual_precision(i1, i2)[source]¶

Computes the mutual precision of two items. Mutual precision is defined as the average of the proportion of members in i1 that are members of i2 and vice versa.

safire.utils.matutils.precision(prediction, true)[source]¶

Computes the precision of the prediction item predicting members of the true item.

Precision for an empty prediction is defined as 1.

safire.utils.matutils.recall(prediction, true)[source]¶

Computes the precision of the prediction item predicting members of the true item.

Recall for an empty prediction is defined as 0.

safire.utils.matutils.rmse(x, y)[source]¶
safire.utils.matutils.rn_rmse(x, y)[source]¶

Range-normalized RMSE.

safire.utils.matutils.scale_to_unit_covariance(array)[source]¶

Transform the array so that all columns have the same covariance.

safire.utils.matutils.uniform_noise(X, p, theano_rng)[source]¶

Adds uniform noise to the given X.

safire.utils.matutils.zero_masking(X, p, theano_rng)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • X – theano.tensor.var.TensorVariable
  • p –
  • theano_rng (theano.) –
